content.en: Machine learning optimization: Researchers have been exploring the use of machine learning algorithms to improve various aspects of machining processes. They have investigated which algorithms perform best for predicting cutting parameters, tool wear, tool life stages, induced residual stresses, energy consumption, surface roughness, and cutting forces in different types of turning and milling. The algorithms used include support vector regression, polynomial regression, artificial neural networks, random forest, back-propagation neural network, multi-objective particle swarm optimization, Gaussian process regression, and more. These studies aim to optimize machining processes and improve the efficiency and quality of manufacturing.
content.da: Maskinlæringsoptimering: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af maskinlæringsalgoritmer til at forbedre forskellige aspekter af bearbejdningsprocesser. De har undersøgt, hvilke algoritmer der fungerer bedst til at forudsige skæreparametre, værktøjsslitage, værktøjslevetidsfaser, inducerede restspændinger, energiforbrug, overfladeruhed og skærekrafter i forskellige typer drejning og fræsning. De anvendte algoritmer inkluderer support vektor regression, polynomium regression, kunstige neurale netværk, random forest, back-propagation neural network, multi-objective particle swarm optimization, Gaussian process regression og flere. Disse undersøgelser har til formål at optimere bearbejdningsprocesser og forbedre effektiviteten og kvaliteten af fremstillingen.
